results.title: When the day breaks
results.brief_description: A chicken man and a pig woman bump into each other setting off a chain of events. 2001 Annecy Winner. One of the most affecting animated films of recent times. A story that highlights the things that connect us.

results.title: When the clouds roll by
results.creator_credit: Sterling Educational Films, Paul Killiam and Saul J. Turell
results.brief_description: By far the best of the action-filled frolics that made Douglas Fairbanks, popular before his swash-buckling period, this film pokes fun at psychiatry in a manner that is still modern. Full of comedy and thrills and dominated by Fairbanks’ breezy personality, we see the star in some truly astounding acrobatics.

results.title: When should grown ups help? the Vassar studies - studies of normal personality development
results.creator_credit: Vassar College, Dept. of Child study
results.brief_description: Shows pre-school children in various situations, in some of which they require help from adults and in others manage successfully by themselves. Points out that sometimes help is necessary for the child to succeed in projects undertaken, and at other times it is important for adults not to impose their standards of speed or efficiency. Presents four scenes without comment, suggesting that the audience decide in which of these episodes the children should have been helped.

results.title: When polar bears swam in the Thames
results.brief_description: To many people the Ice Age is a vague concept belonging to the remote past but geologically it was yesterday. Extraordinary evidence of the Ice Age continues to crop up on the British landscape in lion and hippopotamus fossils in Trafalgar Square, bear and hyena fragments in Devon, fossil remains of a polar bear from Kew. So when polar bears swam in the Thames, did Britain really look like present day Greenland?

results.title: When parents grow old: extract from I never sang for
results.creator_credit: Gilbert Cates, Columbia Pictures and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Searching for values: a film anthology”.
Edited from the motion picture ‘I never sang for my Father” starring Gene Hackman and Melvyn Douglas, this tells the story of a young man who must decide betweeb caring for his elderly wodowed father and marriage. The themes of responisibility to the aged, fear of growing old, and society’s treatment of the elderly are explored.

results.title: When night is falling
results.creator_credit: Barbara Tranter, Crucial Pictures, Alliance Communications and Patricia Rozema
results.brief_description: Camille, a professor of mythology at the Christian New College of Faith, and her boyfriend Martin are being pressured to marry by the principal of the college. When her dog dies Camille finds comfort with Petra, a sexy circus performer, who she meets at a laundry. As their friendship gradually develops into a love affair Camille’s life is turned upside down and she realises she must make a choice between a secure life with her fiance, or one of adventure, passion and uncertainty with Petra. Sumptuously filmed in lush colours, Rozema draws on the magic and drama of daring circus acts to symbolically convey Camille’s struggle to set herself free. Cast includes Pascale Bussieres, Rachael Crawford, Henry Czerny and Don McKellar Winner of Audience Award, Berlin Film Festival 1995.

results.title: When night comes
results.brief_description: A moving portrait of the people, land and culture of Vietnam in the light of the fact that the country has been at war for over thirty years. Elements of art, family life, religion, economics, education and near destruction of the culture are touched upon amidst a delicate framework of Vietnamese poetry.
results.description: A moving portrait of the people, land and culture of Vietnam in the light of the fact that the country has been at war for over thirty years. results.title: When love comes
results.creator_credit: MF Films, New Zealand Film Commission, Jonathan Dowling, Michele Fantl and Garth Maxwell
results.brief_description: Uneven ensemble drama about the value of friendship, intimacy and love. When Katie (Rena Owen), a one hit wonder and faded singer, returns to Auckland after ten years in LA to find new direction in her life, she takes refuge with Stephen, her oldest friend, who is in a difficult relationship with the much younger Mark, a songwriter, substance abuser and ex rent boy. Mark writes songs for a punky energetic young dyke couple who are in a rock band together and who encourage Katie to sing with them. Together they take off to a remote beach house where Stephen and Mark finally confront the demons that shape and inhibit their relationship. More secrets are revealed and needs exposed when Katie’s American lover arrives on the scene. Cast also includes Simon Prast and Dean O’Gorman.
